author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that explores the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry of the early 19th century.

author: Herman Melville
description: The saga of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the great white whale, Moby Dick.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother.

author: Harper Lee
description: A novel that deals with serious issues like racial inequality and rape through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the American dream and the downfall of those who attempt to reach its illusory goals.

author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sprawling epic that tells the story of five families against the backdrop of the Napoleonic Wars.

author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about teenage rebellion and alienation, told through the eyes of the disaffected Holden Caulfield.

author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A novel that follows the experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological drama that delves into the mind of Raskolnikov, a man who believes he is above morality.

author: Homer
description: An epic poem that follows the adventures of Odysseus as he tries to return home after the Trojan War.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel that explores the moral struggles and existential dilemmas of its characters.

author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel that examines a futuristic society driven by technological advancements and state control.

author: Emily Brontë
description: A tale of passion and revenge, set on the bleak Yorkshire moors.

author: Miguel De Cervantes
description: A novel that follows the adventures of a nobleman who believes he is a knight, and his faithful squire, Sancho Panza.

author: Mary Shelley
description: A Gothic novel that tells the story of a scientist who creates a monster, only to be horrified by the consequences.
